chargeHist.descr: Registered Sex Offender Intentionally Photograph a Minor without Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth J. Von Arx was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kenneth J. Von Arx is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kenneth J. Von Arx was found guilty of Registered Sex Offender Intentionally Photograph a Minor without Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.14(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:34 a.m. Defendant Kenneth J. Von Arx in court, in custody, with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan. Steven Mitchell Michlig, Asst. D.A., appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Michlig speaks to agreement/resolution--free to argue sentencing. State moves to dismiss Ct. 1; granted. Plea questionnare & waiver filed. Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 2. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free & voluntary. Court finds factual basis for plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 2. Michlig/Hogan statement to sentencing. Def. Exh. 1 (Psychological report) marked, offered, received. 11:01 a.m. off the record. 11:07 a.m. back on record; all parties present. Court statement. Hogan requests return of property belonging to Joseph Von Arx. Michlig statement--no objection provided ownership shown. Court statement. Hogan statement to Kenneth's property. Court orders return of all property not considered contraband. 

Court sentence
WHS
3 yrs. POP
1 yr. county jail w/Huber
Community service according to s.973.09
153 days' credit upon revocation
CC/CV/Surcharge
DNA sample, if not already done so
No consumption of alcohol
Employment 35 hrs./week or full-time student; until then 3 job searches per week; provide agent w/report of monthly job searches
AODA assessment and follow-through
Computer subject to random searches
Sex offender program and completion
Ineligible Voting Notice given
Appeal Rights given
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2014 at 10:30 am.

3:00 p.m. Defendant Kenneth J. Von Arx in court, in custody, with attorney Mary M. Hogan. Steven Mitchell Michlig, Asst. D.A., appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense motion filed regarding in-camera inspection. Court statement. Hogan has not received all discovery; speaks to motion to compel/summary of expert opinions offered. Michlig response. Court statement/questions the State. Court reminds State that there has been a speedy trial demand. Hogan statement; requests Court order information provided to her by next week. Court statement/Hogan statement - methodologies. Court orders State provide all information to Attorney Hogan by Friday, October 3, 2014. Further discussion by Court/counsel. Court speaks to s. 971.23. Court grants defense motion to compel. Hogan to prepare Order. 

Hogan speaks to the in-camera motion. Michlig statement--just now in receipt of motion. Court statement. Michlig objects to lack of notice to motion. Hogan statement. Court postpones ruling for in-camera inspection to give State time to review motion. Bond continued. 3:42 p.m. adj.

Jury trial on October 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing on September 26, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Compel Summary of Opinions to be Offered By State's Expert Witnesses
Pre-trial conference on September 11, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Kenneth J. Von Arx in court with attorney Mary M. Hogan.  Defendant Kenneth J. Von Arx in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:51
Michlig statement - no agreement as of yet - Hogan statement to status/tests/evaulation defendant is undergoing - Gives further statement to bail - Michlig statement to bail - 
Court statement - Court continues bail as set  - Court will set for trial - Leah to contact counsel/clerk and schedule from there -  Need further action scheduled for August 14, 2014 at 08:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 31, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

03:31 pm - Defendant Kenneth J. Vonarx in court with attorney Mary M Hogan.  Defendant Kenneth J. Vonarx in custody.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  In receipt of Information, waives reading and enters not guilty pleas.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 5, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

08:02 am - Defendant Kenneth J. Vonarx in court with attorney Mary M Hogan.  Defendant Kenneth J. Vonarx in custody.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State calls Oneida County Sheriff's Deputy Lee Lech/Sworn/Direct by Michlig-Witness ID's defendant/Cross by Hogan.  Hogan/Michlig statement to finding of probable cause.  Court finds probable cause does exist and binds defendant over for trial.  Bail continued.  Arraignment scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant has contacted PD waiting to hear who will represent.  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.
